intent_atoms.description: User can persist and reset settings in the Settings Panel via UserPreferencesStore and DocumentSessionController.
Settings persistence must be thread‑safe and consistent across sessions.
Reset actions require confirmation dialogs before clearing settings.
Persistence is threaded through UserPreferencesStore and DocumentSessionController.
Automate strict concurrency checks during build and test phases using --strict-concurrency=complete flag.
Pre‑push hooks must enforce strict concurrency checks before code is pushed.
GitHub Actions CI workflows must include jobs that run strict concurrency checks.
Strict concurrency checks are integrated into .githooks/pre-push and .github/workflows/ci.yml.

functional_units.name: User Settings Panel Persistence
functional_units.description: Stores user preferences in UserPreferencesStore and DocumentSessionController, ensuring settings persist across sessions.

functional_units.name: User Settings Reset Action
functional_units.description: Provides reset actions with confirmation dialogs to revert settings to defaults.

functional_units.name: Strict Concurrency Check Hook
functional_units.description: Automates strict concurrency checks using --strict-concurrency=complete flag during pre-push Git hooks.

functional_units.name: CI Strict Concurrency Job
functional_units.description: Extends GitHub Actions CI workflow to run strict concurrency jobs on every build and test phase.

functional_units.name: Concurrency Documentation & Rollout
functional_units.description: Documents and rolls out the strict concurrency enforcement, updating PRD with passing logs.
